alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Tuscaloosa; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:36PM CST until February 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Locust Fork At Sayre affecting Tuscaloosa, Walker and Jefferson Counties. .Heavy rainfall during the past 24 hours over the Black Warrior River basin has resulted in sharp water rises. A flood warning is now in effect for the Black Warrior River with a crest at minor flood stage forecast tonight before steadily falling later on Saturday. Another statement will be issued by Saturday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Locust Fork At Sayre. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Flooding of low lying wood lands and agricultural lands along the Locust Fork occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
